title: Plants and animals depend on each other
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental education
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Science - Study and teaching (Primary)
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Biology - Study and teaching (Primary)
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Biology - Study and teaching (Primary)
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Science - Study and teaching (Primary)
description: Allows children to investigate the question - why is it that plants and animals always seem to live together? As they observe relationships among plants and animals in an aquarium, in ponds, woodlands, grass lands, and in the ocean. Food, shelter, transportation, oxygen, carbon dioxide and reproduction are some of the needs and processes examined.
